title: Eppa Rixey
summary: Eppa Rixey Jr. (May 3, 1891 – February 28, 1963), nicknamed "Jephtha",[upper-alpha 1] was an American baseball player who played 21 seasons for the Philadelphia Phillies and Cincinnati Reds in Major League Baseball from 1912 to 1933 as a left-handed pitcher. Rixey was best known as the National League's leader in career victories for a left-hander with 266 wins until Warren Spahn surpassed his total in 1959.
